intro: Rapunculus pauciflorus, commonly known as the few-flowered cuckoo's beak, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and basal leaves. Its flowers are yellowish-green with four petals and are arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. It is often found in rocky or alpine environments and is adapted to cool, dry climates.
